thread.title: eTolls have made Johannesburg’s traffic much better
thread.title_full: eTolls have made Johannesburg’s traffic much better

author: Staff Writer
title: eTolls have made Johannesburg’s traffic much better
text:
Bucharest – 50% 
TomTom also announced which cities deserve recognition for their efforts to beat traffic congestion. 
Six cities were chosen for special recognition by an international panel of traffic experts. The winners included: Johannesburg Stockholm Rio de Janeiro 
TomTom’s Traffic Index showed that Johannesburg has experienced a marked improvement in traffic congestion since 2009. 
However, Johannesburg did see a 3% increase in traffic congestion since 2015 and currently sits at a congestion level of 30%. 
Traffic congestion has also worsened in Cape Town by 5%, to a new average of 35%. 
“The Gauteng Freeway Improvement Project, Open Road Tolling, and numerous ITS applications implemented along freeway corridors have had a positive impact on traffic congestion, not to mention the establishment of the Gautrain,” said Megan Bruwer, Project Coordinator for the Stellenbosch Smart Mobility Laboratory. TomTom congestion ranking for SA Rank
